pli-tv-pvr17:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-pvr17:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-pvr17:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upāli yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-pvr17:1.2.eng: Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-pvr17:1.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā upāli bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-pvr17:1.4.pli: “katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabban”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:1.4.eng: “Venerable sir, what sort of monk should live with formal support for life?”

pli-tv-pvr17:2.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:2.3.pli: Uposathaṃ na jānāti, uposathakammaṃ na jānāti, pātimokkhaṃ na jānāti, pātimokkhuddesaṃ na jānāti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:2.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know about the observance-day ceremony; (2) he doesn’t know the observance-day procedure; (3) he doesn’t know the Monastic Code; (4) he doesn’t know the recitation of the Monastic Code; (5) he has less than five years of seniority.
pli-tv-pvr17:2.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “observance-day ceremony” for uposatha, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr17:2.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:2.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:2.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support for life:

pli-tv-pvr17:2.7.pli: Uposathaṃ jānāti, uposathakammaṃ jānāti, pātimokkhaṃ jānāti, pātimokkhuddesaṃ jānāti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-pvr17:2.7.eng: (1) he knows about the observance-day ceremony; (2) he knows the observance-day procedure; (3) he knows the Monastic Code; (4) he knows the recitation of the Monastic Code; (5) he has five or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-pvr17:2.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:3.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:3.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities should also live with formal support for life:

pli-tv-pvr17:3.3.pli: Pavāraṇaṃ na jānāti, pavāraṇākammaṃ na jānāti, pātimokkhaṃ na jānāti, pātimokkhuddesaṃ na jānāti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:3.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know about the invitation ceremony; (2) he doesn’t know the invitation procedure; (3) he doesn’t know the Monastic Code; (4) he doesn’t know the recitation of the Monastic Code; (5) he has less than five years of seniority.
pli-tv-pvr17:3.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “invitation ceremony” for pavāraṇā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr17:3.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:3.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:3.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support for life:

pli-tv-pvr17:3.7.pli: Pavāraṇaṃ jānāti, pavāraṇākammaṃ jānāti, pātimokkhaṃ jānāti, pātimokkhuddesaṃ jānāti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-pvr17:3.7.eng: (1) he knows about the invitation ceremony; (2) he knows the invitation procedure; (3) he knows the Monastic Code; (4) he knows the recitation of the Monastic Code; (5) he has five or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-pvr17:3.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ anissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:4.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:4.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities should also live with formal support for life:

pli-tv-pvr17:4.3.pli: Āpattānāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukagarukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, ūnapañcavasso hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:4.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the offenses and non-offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the light and heavy offenses; (3) he doesn’t know the curable and incurable offenses; (4) he doesn’t know the grave and minor offenses; (5) he has less than five years of seniority.

pli-tv-pvr17:4.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ nānissitena vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:4.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ anissitena vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:4.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may live without formal support for life:

pli-tv-pvr17:4.7.pli: Āpattānāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukagarukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, pañcavasso vā hoti atirekapañcavasso vā—
pli-tv-pvr17:4.7.eng: (1) he knows the offenses and non-offenses; (2) he knows the light and heavy offenses; (3) he knows the curable and incurable offenses; (4) he knows the grave and minor offenses; (5) he has five or more years of seniority.

pli-tv-pvr17:4.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā yāvajīvaṃ anissitena vatthabbaṃ”.

pli-tv-pvr17:5.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:5.1.eng: “Sir, what sort of monk shouldn’t give the full ordination or formal support, nor have a novice monk attend on him?”
pli-tv-pvr17:5.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “formal support” for nissaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr17:6.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:6.3.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā, anabhirataṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā, uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ, abhidhamme vinetuṃ, abhivinaye vinetuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:6.3.eng: He’s incapable of three things in regard to a student: (1) of nursing him or having him nursed when he’s sick; (2) of sending him away or having him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; and (3) of using the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And (4) he is incapable of training him in the Teaching; and (5) he is incapable of training him in the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr17:6.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:6.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:6.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination and formal support, and he may have a novice monk attend on him:

pli-tv-pvr17:6.7.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā, anabhirataṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā, uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ, abhidhamme vinetuṃ, abhivinaye vinetuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:6.7.eng: He’s capable of three things in regard to a student: (1) of nursing him or having him nursed when he’s sick; (2) of sending him away or having him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; and (3) of using the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And (4) he is capable of training him in the Teaching; and (5) he is capable of training him in the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr17:6.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:7.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:7.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t give the full ordination or formal support, nor have a novice monk attend on him:

pli-tv-pvr17:7.3.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṃ, ādibrahmacāriyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṃ, adhisīle vinetuṃ, adhicitte vinetuṃ, adhipaññāya vinetuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:7.3.eng: He’s incapable of five things in regard to a student: (1) of training him in good conduct; (2) of training him in the basics of the spiritual life; (3) of training him in the higher morality; (4) of training him in the higher mind; (5) of training him in the higher wisdom.

pli-tv-pvr17:7.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā na upasampādetabbaṃ, na nissayo dātabbo, na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:7.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:7.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may give the full ordination and formal support, and he may have a novice monk attend on him:

pli-tv-pvr17:7.7.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṃ vā saddhivihāriṃ vā abhisamācārikāya sikkhāya sikkhāpetuṃ, ādibrahmacāriyakāya sikkhāya vinetuṃ, adhisīle vinetuṃ, adhicitte vinetuṃ, adhipaññāya vinetuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:7.7.eng: He’s capable of five things in regard to a student: (1) of training him in good conduct; (2) of training him in the basics of the spiritual life; (3) of training him in the higher morality; (4) of training him in the higher mind; (5) of training him in the higher wisdom.”

pli-tv-pvr17:7.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ, nissayo dātabbo, sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:8.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabban”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:8.1.eng: “Sir, against what sort of monk should a legal procedure be done?”

pli-tv-pvr17:9.1.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:9.3.pli: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:9.3.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk, and he has wrong view, and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:9.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:10.1.pli: “Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:10.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:10.3.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:10.3.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:10.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:11.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:11.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:11.3.pli: Kāyikena davena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:11.3.eng: his bodily conduct is frivolous; his verbal conduct is frivolous; his bodily and verbal conduct are frivolous; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:11.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:12.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:12.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:12.3.pli: Kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:12.3.eng: he is improperly behaved by body; he is improperly behaved by speech; he is improperly behaved by body and speech; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:12.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:13.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:13.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:13.3.pli: Kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:13.3.eng: his bodily conduct is harmful; his verbal conduct is harmful; his bodily and verbal conduct are harmful; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:13.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:14.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:14.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:14.3.pli: Kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:14.3.eng: he has wrong livelihood by body; he has wrong livelihood by speech; he has wrong livelihood by body and speech; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:14.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:15.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:15.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:15.3.pli: Āpattiṃ āpanno kammakato upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-pvr17:15.3.eng: if, after committing an offense and having had a legal procedure done against him, he: (1) gives the full ordination, (2) gives formal support, (3) has a novice monk attend on him, (4) accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns, (5) instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-pvr17:15.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:16.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:16.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:16.3.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena kammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ, kammaṃ garahati, kammike garahati—
pli-tv-pvr17:16.3.eng: (1) he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; (2) he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; (3) he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; (4) he criticizes the procedure; (5) he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-pvr17:16.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:17.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:17.1.eng: A legal procedure should also be done against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:17.3.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:17.3.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.”

pli-tv-pvr17:17.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ kātabban”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:18.1.eng: The first subchapter on “without formal support” is finished.

pli-tv-pvr17:20.2.eng: And offense, one who is sick;

pli-tv-pvr17:21.3.eng: Offense for which, of the Buddha—

pli-tv-pvr17:21.4.eng: The compilation of the first subchapter is finished.”

pli-tv-pvr17:22.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabban”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:22.1.eng: “Sir, for what sort of monk should a legal procedure not be lifted?”

pli-tv-pvr17:23.1.eng: “For one who has five qualities, Upāli:

pli-tv-pvr17:23.3.pli: Āpattiṃ āpanno kammakato upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-pvr17:23.3.eng: if, after committing an offense and having had a legal procedure done against him, he: (1) gives the full ordination, (2) gives formal support, (3) has a novice monk attend on him, (4) accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns, (5) instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-pvr17:23.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:24.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:24.1.eng: A legal procedure should also not be lifted for a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:24.3.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena kammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ, kammaṃ garahati, kammike garahati—
pli-tv-pvr17:24.3.eng: (1) he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; (2) he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; (3) he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the legal procedure against him; (4) he criticizes the procedure; (5) he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-pvr17:24.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:25.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:25.1.eng: A legal procedure should also not be lifted for a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:25.3.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, micchādiṭṭhiko ca hoti, ājīvavipanno ca—
pli-tv-pvr17:25.3.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha; he has wrong view; and he has failed in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr17:25.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:26.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:26.1.eng: A legal procedure should also not be lifted for a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:26.3.pli: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, omaddakārako ca hoti, vattesu sikkhāya ca na paripūrakārī—
pli-tv-pvr17:26.3.eng: he is shameless, ignorant, and not a regular monk, and he is a bully, and he doesn’t fulfill the training in proper conduct.”

pli-tv-pvr17:26.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno kammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabban”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:27.1.pli: “Saṅgāmāvacarena, bhante, bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamantena kati dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā saṅgho upasaṅkamitabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:27.1.eng: “Sir, when a monk is involved in a conflict and is about to approach the Sangha, how many qualities should he first set up in himself?”

pli-tv-pvr17:28.1.pli: “Saṅgāmāvacarena, upāli, bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamantena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā saṅgho upasaṅkamitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:28.1.eng: “He should set up five qualities in himself:

pli-tv-pvr17:28.3.pli: Saṅgāmāvacarena, upāli, bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamantena nīcacittena saṅgho upasaṅkamitabbo, rajoharaṇasamena cittena, āsanakusalena bhavitabbaṃ nissajjakusalena, there bhikkhū anupakhajjantena, nave bhikkhū āsanena appaṭibāhantena yathāpatirūpe āsane nisīditabbaṃ, anānākathikena bhavitabbaṃ atiracchānakathikena, sāmaṃ vā dhammo bhāsitabbo, paro vā ajjhesitabbo, ariyo vā tuṇhībhāvo nātimaññitabbo, sace, upāli, saṅgho samaggakaraṇīyāni kammāni karoti;
pli-tv-pvr17:28.3.eng: (1) he should be humble; (2) he should be intent on removing defilements; (3) he should be skilled in appropriate seating and where to sit down, taking a seat without encroaching on the senior monks and without blocking the junior monks; (4) he shouldn’t ramble or engage in worldly talk, but should speak according to the Teaching or invite others to speak or value noble silence; (5) if the Sangha is doing legal procedures requiring unity, but the monk doesn’t approve, then he should reveal his view but think, ‘I shouldn’t be at variance with the Sangha,’ and unity can then be announced.”

pli-tv-pvr17:28.4.pli: tatra ce, upāli, bhikkhuno nakkhamati, api diṭṭhāvikammaṃ katvā ñāpetabbā sāmaggī.

pli-tv-pvr17:28.7.pli: Saṅgāmāvacarenupāli, bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamantena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā saṅgho upasaṅkamitabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:29.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanaarucito cā”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:29.1.eng: “What sort of monk does the majority dislike and disapprove of when he speaks in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-pvr17:30.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanarucito ca.

pli-tv-pvr17:30.3.pli: Ussitamantī ca hoti, nissitajappī ca, na ca bhāsānusandhikusalo hoti, na yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, na yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:30.3.eng: (1) he’s arrogant; (2) he repeats what others say; (3) he doesn’t keep to the topic; (4) he doesn’t accuse others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, or their offense; (5) he doesn’t act according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, or his offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:30.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanaarucito ca.

pli-tv-pvr17:30.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanakanto ca hoti bahujanamanāpo ca bahujanarucito ca.
pli-tv-pvr17:30.5.eng: But when a monk has five qualities, the majority likes and approves of him when he speaks in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:30.7.pli: Na ussitamantī ca hoti, na nissitajappī ca, bhāsānusandhikusalo ca hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:30.7.eng: (1) he’s not arrogant; (2) he doesn’t repeat what others say; (3) he keeps to the topic; (4) he accuses others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and their offense; (5) he acts according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and his offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:30.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanakanto ca hoti bahujanamanāpo ca bahujanarucito ca.

pli-tv-pvr17:31.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanaarucito ca.
pli-tv-pvr17:31.1.eng: When a monk has five other qualities, the majority dislikes and disapproves of him when he speaks in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:31.3.pli: Ussādetā ca hoti, apasādetā ca, adhammaṃ gaṇhāti, dhammaṃ paṭibāhati, samphañca bahuṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-pvr17:31.3.eng: (1) he praises; and (2) he blames; (3) he maintains what is contrary to the Teaching; (4) he obstructs what is in accordance with the Teaching; and (5) he often speaks frivolously.

pli-tv-pvr17:31.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanaarucito ca.

pli-tv-pvr17:31.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanakanto ca hoti bahujanamanāpo ca bahujanarucito ca.
pli-tv-pvr17:31.5.eng: But when a monk has five qualities, the majority likes and approves of him when he speaks in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:31.7.pli: Na ussādetā ca hoti, na apasādetā ca, dhammaṃ gaṇhāti, adhammaṃ paṭibāhati, samphañca na bahuṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-pvr17:31.7.eng: (1) he doesn’t praise; and (2) he doesn’t blame; (3) he maintains what is in accordance with the Teaching; (4) he obstructs what is contrary to the Teaching; and (5) he rarely speaks frivolously.

pli-tv-pvr17:31.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanakanto ca hoti bahujanamanāpo ca bahujanarucito ca.

pli-tv-pvr17:32.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanaarucito ca.
pli-tv-pvr17:32.1.eng: When a monk has five other qualities, the majority dislikes and disapproves of him when he speaks in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:32.3.pli: Pasayhapavattā hoti, anokāsakammaṃ kāretvā pavattā hoti, na yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, na yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti, na yathādiṭṭhiyā byākatā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:32.3.eng: (1) he speaks forcefully; (2) he speaks without having gotten permission; (3) he doesn’t accuse others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, or their offense; (4) he doesn’t act according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, or his offenses; (5) he doesn’t explain things according to his own view.

pli-tv-pvr17:32.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanaakanto ca hoti bahujanaamanāpo ca bahujanaarucito ca.

pli-tv-pvr17:32.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanakanto ca hoti bahujanamanāpo ca bahujanarucito ca.
pli-tv-pvr17:32.5.eng: But when a monk has five qualities, the majority likes and approves of him when he speaks in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:32.7.pli: Na pasayhapavattā hoti, okāsakammaṃ kāretvā pavattā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti, yathādiṭṭhiyā byākatā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:32.7.eng: (1) he doesn’t speak forcefully; (2) he doesn’t speak without having gotten permission; (3) he accuses others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and their offense; (4) he acts according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and his offenses; (5) he explains things according to his own view.”

pli-tv-pvr17:32.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu saṅghe voharanto bahujanakanto ca hoti bahujanamanāpo ca bahujanarucito cā”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:33.1.eng: “Sir, how many benefits are there of studying the Monastic Law?”

pli-tv-pvr17:34.3.pli: Attano sīlakkhandho sugutto hoti surakkhito, kukkuccapakatānaṃ paṭisaraṇaṃ hoti, visārado saṅghamajjhe voharati, paccatthike sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggaṇhāti, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā paṭipanno hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:34.3.eng: (1) your own morality is well guarded; (2) you’re a refuge for those who are habitually anxious; (3) you speak with confidence in the midst of the Sangha; (4) you can legitimately and properly refute an opponent; (5) you’re practicing for the longevity of the true Teaching.”

pli-tv-pvr17:35.1.eng: The second subchapter on not lifting is finished.

pli-tv-pvr17:39.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabban”ti
pli-tv-pvr17:39.1.eng: “Sir, what sort of monk shouldn’t speak in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-pvr17:40.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:40.3.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, āpattisamuṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā payogaṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā vūpasamaṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā na vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:40.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the origination of the offenses; (3) he doesn’t know the kind of effort required to commit the offenses; (4) he doesn’t know the settling of offenses; (5) he’s not skilled in deciding on offenses.
pli-tv-pvr17:40.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Āpattiyā payogaṁ na jānātīti “ayaṁ āpatti kāyappayogā, ayaṁ vacīpayogā”ti na jānāti … Āpattiyā na vinicchayakusalo hotīti “imasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ ayaṁ āpattī”ti na jānāti, “Āpattiyā payogaṁ na jānāti means he does not know: ‘This is an offense because of bodily effort; this is an offense because of verbal effort.’ … Āpattiyā na vinicchayakusalo hoti means he does not know: ‘When there is this action, there is this offense.’”

pli-tv-pvr17:40.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:40.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:40.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:40.7.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, āpattisamuṭṭhānaṃ jānāti, āpattiyā payogaṃ jānāti, āpattiyā vūpasamaṃ jānāti, āpattiyā vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:40.7.eng: (1) he knows the offenses; (2) he knows the origination of the offenses; (3) he knows the kind of effort required to commit the offenses; (4) he knows the settling of offenses; (5) he’s skilled in deciding on offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:40.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:41.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:41.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:41.3.pli: Adhikaraṇaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa payogaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vūpasamaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa na vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:41.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the legal issues; (2) he doesn’t know the origination of the legal issues; (3) he doesn’t know the kind of effort that is the source of the legal issues; (4) he doesn’t know the settling of legal issues; (5) he’s not skilled in deciding legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr17:41.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Adhikaraṇānañhi yathāsakaṁmūlameva payogā nāma honti, “For it is just the root of the legal issues that is called effort.”

pli-tv-pvr17:41.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:41.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:41.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:41.7.pli: Adhikaraṇaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa payogaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vūpasamaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:41.7.eng: (1) he knows the legal issues; (2) he knows the origination of the legal issues; (3) he knows the kind of effort that is the source of the legal issues; (4) he knows the settling of legal issues; (5) he’s skilled in deciding legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr17:41.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:42.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:42.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:42.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:42.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:42.7.pli: Na pasayhapavattā hoti, okāsakammaṃ kāretvā pavattā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti, yathādiṭṭhiyā byākatā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:42.7.eng: (1) he doesn’t speak forcefully; (2) he doesn’t speak without having gotten permission; (3) he accuses others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and their offense; (4) he acts according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and his offenses; (5) he explains things according to his own view.

pli-tv-pvr17:42.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:43.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:43.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:43.3.pli: Āpattānāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukagarukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, sappaṭikammaṃ appaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:43.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the offenses and non-offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the light and heavy offenses; (3) he doesn’t know the curable and incurable offenses; (4) he doesn’t know the grave and minor offenses; (5) he doesn’t know the offenses that are clearable by making amends and the offenses that are not clearable by making amends.

pli-tv-pvr17:43.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:43.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:43.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:43.7.pli: Āpattānāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukagarukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, sappaṭikammaṃ appaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:43.7.eng: (1) he knows the offenses and non-offenses; (2) he knows the light and heavy offenses; (3) he knows the curable and incurable offenses; (4) he knows the grave and minor offenses; (5) he knows the offenses that are clearable by making amends and the offenses that are not clearable by making amends.

pli-tv-pvr17:43.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:44.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:44.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:44.3.pli: Kammaṃ na jānāti, kammassa karaṇaṃ na jānāti, kammassa vatthuṃ na jānāti, kammassa vattaṃ na jānāti, kammassa vūpasamaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:44.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the legal procedures; (2) he doesn’t know how the legal procedures are done; (3) he doesn’t know the actions that are the bases for the legal procedures; (4) he doesn’t know the proper conduct in relation to the legal procedures; (5) he doesn’t know the settling of the legal procedures.
pli-tv-pvr17:44.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Vattanti sattasu kammesu heṭṭhā catunnaṁ kammānaṁ aṭṭhārasavidhaṁ tividhassa ca ukkhepanīyakammassa tecattālīsavidhaṁ vattaṁ na jānāti, “Vatta: among the seven legal procedures found below, he does not know the eighteen kinds of proper conduct of the four legal procedures or the forty-three kinds of proper conduct of the three kinds of legal procedures of ejection.”

pli-tv-pvr17:44.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:44.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:44.7.eng: (1) he knows the legal procedures; (2) he knows how the legal procedures are done; (3) he knows the actions that are the bases for the legal procedures; (4) he knows the proper conduct in relation to the legal procedures; (5) he knows the settling of the legal procedures.

pli-tv-pvr17:45.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:45.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:45.3.pli: Vatthuṃ na jānāti, nidānaṃ na jānāti, paññattiṃ na jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ na jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:45.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the actions that are the bases for offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the origin stories; (3) he doesn’t know the rules; (4) he doesn’t know the right order of words; (5) he doesn’t know the sequence of statements.
pli-tv-pvr17:45.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Padapaccābhaṭṭhaṁ na jānātīti sammukhā kātabbaṁ padaṁ na jānāti. “Buddho bhagavā”ti vattabbe “bhagavā buddho”ti heṭṭhupariyaṁ katvā padaṁ yojeti, “Padapaccābhaṭṭhaṁ na jānāti: he does not know the words that are to be done in the presence of. When ‘Buddho bhagavā’ is to be said, having reversed the order, he makes it ‘bhagavā Buddho’.” | Sp 5.325: Anusandhivacanapathanti kathānusandhi-vinicchayānusandhivasena vatthuṁ na jānāti, “Anusandhivacanapatha: he does not understand the basis for the sequence of statements and the sequence of decisions.”

pli-tv-pvr17:45.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:45.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:45.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:45.7.pli: Vatthuṃ jānāti, nidānaṃ jānāti, paññattiṃ jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:45.7.eng: (1) he knows the actions that are the bases for offenses; (2) he knows the origin stories; (3) he knows the rules; (4) he knows the right order of words; (5) he knows the sequence of statements.

pli-tv-pvr17:45.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:46.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:46.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:47.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:47.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:47.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:47.7.eng: he’s not biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he’s skilled in the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr17:47.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:48.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:48.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:48.3.pli: Ñattiṃ na jānāti, ñattiyā karaṇaṃ na jānāti, ñattiyā anussāvanaṃ na jānāti, ñattiyā samathaṃ na jānāti, ñattiyā vūpasamaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:48.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the motion; (2) he doesn’t know how the motion is done; (3) he doesn’t know the proclamation of the motion; (4) he doesn’t know settling through a motion; (5) he doesn’t know resolution through a motion.
pli-tv-pvr17:48.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Ñattiyā samathaṁ na jānātīti yvāyaṁ sativinayo, amūḷhavinayo, tassapāpiyasikā, tiṇavatthārakoti catubbidho samatho ñattiyā vinā na hoti, taṁ ñattiyā samathoti na jānāti. Ñattiyā vūpasamaṁ na jānātīti yaṁ adhikaraṇaṁ iminā catubbidhena ñattisamathena vūpasamati, tassa taṁ vūpasamaṁ “ayaṁ ñattiyā vūpasamo kato”ti na jānāti, “‘He doesn’t know settling through a motion’: without a motion, there is no fourfold settling of resolution through recollection, of resolution because of past insanity, of a further penalty, or of covering over as if with grass. He does not know that settling through a motion. ‘He doesn’t know resolution through a motion’: regarding a legal issue that is resolved through this fourfold settling through a motion, he does not know the resolution of it: ‘This resolution is done through a motion’.”

pli-tv-pvr17:48.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:48.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:48.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:48.7.pli: Ñattiṃ jānāti, ñattiyā karaṇaṃ jānāti, ñattiyā anussāvanaṃ jānāti, ñattiyā samathaṃ jānāti, ñattiyā vūpasamaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:48.7.eng: (1) he knows the motion; (2) he knows how the motion is done; (3) he knows the proclamation of the motion; (4) he knows settling by way of a motion; (5) he knows resolution by way of a motion.

pli-tv-pvr17:48.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:49.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:49.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:49.3.pli: Suttaṃ na jānāti, suttānulomaṃ na jānāti, vinayaṃ na jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ na jānāti, na ca ṭhānāṭhānakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:49.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the Monastic Code; (2) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Code; (3) he doesn’t know the Monastic Law; (4) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s not skilled in what is and is not possible.
pli-tv-pvr17:49.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Suttaṁ na jānātīti ubhatovibhaṅgaṁ na jānāti. Suttānulomaṁ na jānātīti cattāro mahāpadese na jānāti. Vinayaṁ na jānātīti khandhakaparivāraṁ na jānāti. Vinayānulomaṁ na jānātīti cattāro mahāpadeseyeva na jānāti, “‘He doesn’t know the Monastic Code’: he does not know the analyses of both Monastic Codes. ‘He doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Code’: he does not know the four great standards. ‘He doesn’t know the Monastic Law’: he does not know the Chapters and the Compendium. ‘He doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law’: he does not know the four great standards.” Instead of following the commentary, I prefer to understand the word sutta in its early usage of Monastic Code, equivalent to the Pātimokkha, and Vinaya as the entire Vinaya corpus, the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr17:49.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:49.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:49.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:49.7.pli: Suttaṃ jānāti, suttānulomaṃ jānāti, vinayaṃ jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ jānāti, ṭhānāṭhānakusalo ca hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:49.7.eng: (1) he knows the Monastic Code; (2) he knows what’s in accordance with the Monastic Code; (3) he knows the Monastic Law; (4) he knows what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s skilled in what is and is not possible.

pli-tv-pvr17:49.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:50.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:50.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:50.3.pli: Dhammaṃ na jānāti, dhammānulomaṃ na jānāti, vinayaṃ na jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ na jānāti, na ca pubbāparakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:50.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the Teaching; (2) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Teaching; (3) he doesn’t know the Monastic Law; (4) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s not skilled in the right order.
pli-tv-pvr17:50.3.comm: Sp 5.424: Na ca pubbāparakusalo hotīti purekathāya ca pacchākathāya ca akusalo hoti, “‘He’s not skilled in the right order’: he is unskilled in what should be said first and what should be said afterwards.”

pli-tv-pvr17:50.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe na voharitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:50.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:50.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may speak in the Sangha:

pli-tv-pvr17:50.7.pli: Dhammaṃ jānāti, dhammānulomaṃ jānāti, vinayaṃ jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ jānāti, pubbāparakusalo ca hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:50.7.eng: (1) he knows the Teaching; (2) he knows what’s in accordance with the Teaching; (3) he knows the Monastic Law; (4) he knows what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s skilled in the right order.”

pli-tv-pvr17:50.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saṅghe voharitabban”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:51.1.eng: The third subchapter on speech is finished.

pli-tv-pvr17:53.3.eng: Legal procedures, the actions that are the bases, and shameless,

pli-tv-pvr17:53.5.eng: He does not know the Monastic Code, or the Teaching—

pli-tv-pvr17:54.0.eng: 4. The subchapter on revealing one’s view

pli-tv-pvr17:54.1.eng: “Sir, how many illegitimate kinds of revealing one’s view are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:55.3.pli: Anāpattiyā diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, desitāya āpattiyā diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, catūhi pañcahi diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, mano mānasena diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:55.3.eng: (1) one reveals a view about a non-offense; (2) one reveals a view about an offense that isn’t clearable by confession; (3) one reveals a view about an offense that has been confessed; (4) one reveals a view to four or five people; (5) one reveals a view by mind.
pli-tv-pvr17:55.3.comm: Sp 5.425: Anāpattiyā diṭṭhiṁ āvi karotīti anāpattimeva āpattīti desetīti attho, “‘One reveals a view about a non-offense’: the meaning is that one confesses a non-offense as an offense.” Sp 5.425: Catūhi pañcahi diṭṭhinti … cattāro pañca janā ekato āpattiṁ desentīti attho, “‘A view to four or five people’: … The meaning is that he confesses the offense to four or five people together.” Sp 5.425: Manomānasena … vacībhedaṁ akatvā citteneva āpattiṁ desetīti attho, “‘By mind’: the meaning is that he confesses the offense by mind, without breaking into speech.”

pli-tv-pvr17:55.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca adhammikā diṭṭhāvikammā.

pli-tv-pvr17:56.1.eng: But there are five legitimate kinds of revealing one’s view:

pli-tv-pvr17:56.3.pli: Āpattiyā diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, adesitāya āpattiyā diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, na catūhi pañcahi diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, na mano mānasena diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:56.3.eng: (1) one reveals a view about an offense; (2) one reveals a view about an offense that’s clearable by confession; (3) one reveals a view about an offense that hasn’t been confessed; (4) one doesn’t reveal a view to four or five people; (5) one doesn’t reveal a view by mind.

pli-tv-pvr17:56.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca dhammikā diṭṭhāvikammā.

pli-tv-pvr17:57.1.eng: There are five other illegitimate kinds of revealing one’s view:

pli-tv-pvr17:57.3.pli: Nānāsaṃvāsakassa santike diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, nānāsīmāya ṭhitassa santike diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, apakatattassa santike diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, catūhi pañcahi diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, mano mānasena diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:57.3.eng: (1) one reveals a view to someone who belongs to a different Buddhist sect; (2) one reveals a view to someone in a different monastery zone; (3) one reveals a view to someone who’s not a regular monk; (4) one reveals a view to four or five people; (5) one reveals a view by mind.

pli-tv-pvr17:57.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca adhammikā diṭṭhāvikammā.

pli-tv-pvr17:58.1.eng: But there are five legitimate kinds of revealing one’s view:

pli-tv-pvr17:58.3.pli: Samānasaṃvāsakassa santike diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, samānasīmāya ṭhitassa santike diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, pakatattassa santike diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, na catūhi pañcahi diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti, na mano mānasena diṭṭhiṃ āvi karoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:58.3.eng: (1) one reveals a view to someone who belongs to the same Buddhist sect; (2) one reveals a view to someone in the same monastery zone; (3) one reveals a view to a regular monk; (4) one doesn’t reveal a view to four or five people; (5) one doesn’t reveal a view by mind.”

pli-tv-pvr17:58.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca dhammikā diṭṭhāvikammā”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:59.1.eng: “How many illegitimate kinds of receiving are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:60.3.pli: Kāyena diyyamānaṃ kāyena appaṭiggahitaṃ, kāyena diyyamānaṃ kāyappaṭibaddhena appaṭiggahitaṃ, kāyappaṭibaddhena diyyamānaṃ kāyena appaṭiggahitaṃ, kāyappaṭibaddhena diyyamānaṃ kāyappaṭibaddhena appaṭiggahitaṃ, nissaggiyena diyyamānaṃ kāyena vā kāyappaṭibaddhena vā appaṭiggahitaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:60.3.eng: (1) when someone gives by body and one doesn’t receive by body; (2) when someone gives by body and one doesn’t receive with something connected to the body; (3) when someone gives with something connected to the body and one doesn’t receive by body; (4) when someone gives with something connected to the body and one doesn’t receive with something connected to the body; (5) when someone gives by releasing and one doesn’t receive by body or with something connected to the body.

pli-tv-pvr17:60.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca adhammikā paṭiggahā.

pli-tv-pvr17:61.1.eng: But there are five legitimate kinds of receiving:

pli-tv-pvr17:61.3.pli: Kāyena diyyamānaṃ kāyena paṭiggahitaṃ, kāyena diyyamānaṃ kāyappaṭibaddhena paṭiggahitaṃ, kāyappaṭibaddhena diyyamānaṃ kāyena paṭiggahitaṃ, kāyappaṭibaddhena diyyamānaṃ kāyappaṭibaddhena paṭiggahitaṃ, nissaggiyena diyyamānaṃ kāyena vā kāyappaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggahitaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:61.3.eng: (1) when someone gives by body and one receives by body; (2) when someone gives by body and one receives with something connected to the body; (3) when someone gives with something connected to the body and one receives by body; (4) when someone gives with something connected to the body and one receives with something connected to the body; (5) when someone gives by releasing and one receives by body or with something connected to the body.”

pli-tv-pvr17:61.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca dhammikā paṭiggahā”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:62.1.eng: “In how many ways is something considered ‘not left over’?”

pli-tv-pvr17:63.3.pli: Akappiyakataṃ hoti, appaṭiggahitakataṃ hoti anuccāritakataṃ hoti, ahatthapāse kataṃ hoti, alametaṃ sabbanti avuttaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:63.3.eng: (1) the making it left over is done with food that’s unallowable; (2) it’s done with food that hasn’t been received; (3) it’s done with food that’s not held in hand; (4) it’s done by one who’s not within arm’s reach; (5) ‘I’ve had enough,’ hasn’t been said.

pli-tv-pvr17:64.1.eng: And there are five aspects for something to be considered ‘left over’:

pli-tv-pvr17:64.3.pli: Kappiyakataṃ hoti, paṭiggahitakataṃ hoti, uccāritakataṃ hoti, hatthapāse kataṃ hoti, alametaṃ sabbanti vuttaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:64.3.eng: (1) the making it left over is done with food that’s allowable; (2) it’s done with food that has been received; (3) it’s done with food that’s held in hand; (4) it’s done by one who’s within arm’s reach; (5) ‘I’ve had enough,’ has been said.”

pli-tv-pvr17:65.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, ākārehi pavāraṇā paññāyatī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:65.1.eng: “How many aspects are there of refusing an invitation to eat more?”

pli-tv-pvr17:66.3.pli: Asanaṃ paññāyati, bhojanaṃ paññāyati, hatthapāse ṭhito abhiharati, paṭikkhepo paññāyati—
pli-tv-pvr17:66.3.eng: there is eating; there is cooked food; they stand within arm’s reach; there is an offering; there is a refusal.”

pli-tv-pvr17:66.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahākārehi pavāraṇā paññāyatī”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:67.1.eng: “How many illegitimate ways are there of acting according to what has been admitted?”

pli-tv-pvr17:68.3.pli: Bhikkhu pārājikaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti, pārājikena codiyamāno saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpanno paṭijānāti, taṃ saṅgho saṅghādisesena kāreti, adhammikaṃ paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:68.3.eng: (1) A monk has committed an offense entailing expulsion. When he’s accused of having committed such an offense, he admits to committing an offense entailing suspension. The Sangha deals with him for an offense entailing suspension. That acting according to what has been admitted is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr17:68.4.pli: Bhikkhu pārājikaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti, pārājikena codiyamāno pācittiyaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-pvr17:68.4.eng: Again, a monk has committed an offense entailing expulsion. When he’s accused of having committed such an offense, he admits to committing an offense entailing confession …

pli-tv-pvr17:68.6.pli: dukkaṭaṃ ajjhāpanno paṭijānāti, taṃ saṅgho dukkaṭena kāreti, adhammikaṃ paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:68.6.eng: an offense of wrong conduct. The Sangha deals with him for an offense of wrong conduct. That acting according to what has been admitted is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr17:68.7.eng: (2) A monk has committed an offense entailing suspension …

pli-tv-pvr17:68.8.eng: (3) A monk has committed an offense entailing confession …

pli-tv-pvr17:68.9.eng: (4) A monk has committed an offense entailing acknowledgment …

pli-tv-pvr17:68.13.eng: an offense entailing acknowledgment. The Sangha deals with him for an offense entailing acknowledgment. That acting according to what has been admitted is illegitimate.

pli-tv-pvr17:69.4.eng: (2) A monk has committed an offense entailing suspension …

pli-tv-pvr17:70.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātun”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:70.1.eng: “Sir, what sort of monk is unqualified to get permission to correct someone?”

pli-tv-pvr17:71.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:71.3.pli: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, cāvanādhippāyo vattā hoti, no vuṭṭhānādhippāyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:71.3.eng: (1) he’s shameless; (2) he’s ignorant; (3) he’s not a regular monk; (4) he speaks to make someone disrobe, (5) not with the aim of clearing their offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:71.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:72.1.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa alaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:72.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities is qualified to get permission to correct someone:

pli-tv-pvr17:72.3.pli: Lajjī ca hoti, paṇḍito ca, pakatatto ca, vuṭṭhānādhippāyo vattā hoti, no cāvanādhippāyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:72.3.eng: (1) he has a sense of conscience; (2) he’s knowledgeable; (3) he’s a regular monk; (4) he speaks with the aim of clearing someone’s offense, (5) not to make them disrobe.”

pli-tv-pvr17:72.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa alaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātun”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:73.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vinayo na sākacchitabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:73.1.eng: “What sort of monk should one not discuss the Monastic Law with?”

pli-tv-pvr17:74.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vinayo na sākacchitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:74.3.pli: Vatthuṃ na jānāti, nidānaṃ na jānāti, paññattiṃ na jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ na jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:74.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the actions that are the bases for offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the origin stories; (3) he doesn’t know the rules; (4) he doesn’t know the right order of words; (5) he doesn’t know the sequence of statements.

pli-tv-pvr17:74.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vinayo na sākacchitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:75.1.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vinayo sākacchitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:75.1.eng: But the Monastic Law may be discussed with a monk who has five qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:75.3.pli: Vatthuṃ jānāti, nidānaṃ jānāti, paññattiṃ jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:75.3.eng: (1) he knows the actions that are the bases for offenses; (2) he knows the origin stories; (3) he knows the rules; (4) he knows the right order of words; (5) he knows the sequence of statements.”

pli-tv-pvr17:75.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ vinayo sākacchitabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:76.1.eng: “How many kinds of questions and enquiries are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:77.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā pañhaṃ pucchati, pāpiccho icchāpakato pañhaṃ pucchati, paribhavā pañhaṃ pucchati, aññātukāmo pañhaṃ pucchati, sace me pañhaṃ puṭṭho sammadeva byākarissati iccetaṃ kusalaṃ no ce pañhaṃ puṭṭho sammadeva byākarissati ahamassa sammadeva byākarissāmīti pañhaṃ pucchati—
pli-tv-pvr17:77.3.eng: one asks (1) because of stupidity and folly; (2) because one is overcome by bad desires; (3) because of contempt; (4) because one desires to know; (5) because of the thought, ‘If he explains correctly when I ask him, all is well, but if he doesn’t, I’ll explain it correctly to him.’”

pli-tv-pvr17:78.1.eng: “How many kinds of declaration of perfect insight are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:79.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā aññaṃ byākaroti, pāpiccho icchāpakato aññaṃ byākaroti, ummādā cittakkhepā aññaṃ byākaroti, adhimānena aññaṃ byākaroti, bhūtaṃ aññaṃ byākaroti—
pli-tv-pvr17:79.3.eng: one declares perfect insight (1) because of stupidity and folly; (2) because one is overcome by bad desires; (3) because of insanity and derangement; (4) because of overestimation; (5) because it’s true.”

pli-tv-pvr17:80.1.eng: “How many kinds of purification are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:81.3.pli: Nidānaṃ uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ ayaṃ paṭhamā visuddhi, nidānaṃ uddisitvā cattāri pārājikāni uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ ayaṃ dutiyā visuddhi, nidānaṃ uddisitvā cattāri pārājikāni uddisitvā terasa saṅghādisese uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ ayaṃ tatiyā visuddhi, nidānaṃ uddisitvā cattāri pārājikāni uddisitvā terasa saṅghādisese uddisitvā dve aniyate uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ ayaṃ catutthā visuddhi, vitthāreneva pañcamī—
pli-tv-pvr17:81.3.eng: (1) After reciting the introduction, the rest is announced as if heard. (2) After reciting the introduction and the four rules entailing expulsion, the rest is announced as if heard. (3) After reciting the introduction, the four rules entailing expulsion, and the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the rest is announced as if heard. (4) After reciting the introduction, the four rules entailing expulsion, the thirteen rules entailing suspension, and the two undetermined rules, the rest is announced as if heard. (5) In full is the fifth.”
pli-tv-pvr17:81.3.comm: This refers to the recitation of the Monastic Code, the Pātimokkha.

pli-tv-pvr17:82.1.eng: “How many kinds of cooked food are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:83.3.eng: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.”
pli-tv-pvr17:83.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “flour products” for sattu, see Appendix of Technical Terms.
