pli-tv-pvr17:87.1.pli: “Codakena, bhante, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena kati dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā paro codetabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:87.1.eng: “Sir, how many qualities should a monk see in himself before accusing another?”

pli-tv-pvr17:88.1.pli: “Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā paro codetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:88.1.eng: “He should see five qualities in himself:

pli-tv-pvr17:88.3.pli: Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ—

pli-tv-pvr17:89.1.pli: ‘Parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu khomhi, parisuddhenamhi kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:89.1.eng: ‘Is my bodily conduct pure and flawless? Is this quality found in me or not?’

pli-tv-pvr17:89.2.pli: No ce, upāli, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
pli-tv-pvr17:89.2.eng: If it’s not, there will be those who say,

pli-tv-pvr17:89.3.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
pli-tv-pvr17:89.3.eng: ‘Please train your own bodily conduct first.’

pli-tv-pvr17:90.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ—

pli-tv-pvr17:90.2.pli: ‘parisuddhavacīsamācāro nu khomhi, parisuddhenamhi vacīsamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:90.2.eng: ‘Is my verbal conduct pure and flawless? Is this quality found in me or not?’

pli-tv-pvr17:90.3.pli: No ce, upāli, bhikkhu parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, parisuddhena vacīsamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
pli-tv-pvr17:90.3.eng: If it’s not, there will be those who say,

pli-tv-pvr17:90.4.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā vācasikaṃ sikkhassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
pli-tv-pvr17:90.4.eng: ‘Please train your own verbal conduct first.’

pli-tv-pvr17:91.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ—

pli-tv-pvr17:91.2.pli: ‘mettaṃ nu kho me cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:91.2.eng: ‘Do I have a mind of good will toward my fellow monastics, a mind free from anger? Is this quality found in me or not?’

pli-tv-pvr17:91.3.pli: No ce, upāli, bhikkhuno mettaṃ cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
pli-tv-pvr17:91.3.eng: If it’s not, there will be those who say,

pli-tv-pvr17:91.4.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mettaṃ cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpehī’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.
pli-tv-pvr17:91.4.eng: ‘Please set up a mind of good will toward your fellow monastics first.’

pli-tv-pvr17:92.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ—

pli-tv-pvr17:92.2.pli: ‘bahussuto nu khomhi sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpā me dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:92.2.eng: ‘Have I learned much and do I retain and accumulate what I’ve learned? Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—have I learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view? Is this quality found in me or not?’

pli-tv-pvr17:92.3.pli: No ce, upāli, bhikkhu bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpassa dhammā na bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, tassa bhavanti vattāro—
pli-tv-pvr17:92.3.eng: If it’s not, there will be those who say,

pli-tv-pvr17:92.4.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā āgamaṃ pariyāpuṇassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.

pli-tv-pvr17:93.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upāli, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ—

pli-tv-pvr17:93.2.pli: ‘ubhayāni kho me pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:93.2.eng: ‘Have I properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail; have I analyzed them well, thoroughly mastered them, and investigated them well, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition? Is this quality found in me or not?’

pli-tv-pvr17:93.3.pli: No ce, upāli, bhikkhuno ubhayāni pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, ‘idaṃ panāvuso kattha vuttaṃ bhagavatā’ti iti puṭṭho na sampāyati, (…) tassa bhavanti vattāro—
pli-tv-pvr17:93.3.eng: If it’s not, then when he’s asked, ‘Where was this said by the Buddha?’ he won’t be able to reply. And there will be those who say,

pli-tv-pvr17:93.4.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇassū’ti itissa bhavanti vattāro.

pli-tv-pvr17:93.5.pli: Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā paro codetabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:94.1.pli: “Codakena, bhante, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena kati dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:94.1.eng: “Sir, how many qualities should a monk set up in himself before accusing another?”

pli-tv-pvr17:95.1.pli: “Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:95.1.eng: “He should set up five qualities in himself:

pli-tv-pvr17:95.3.pli: Kālena vakkhāmi no akālena, bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena, saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena, atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi no anatthasaṃhitena, mettācitto vakkhāmi no dosantaroti—
pli-tv-pvr17:95.3.eng: (1) ‘I’ll speak at an appropriate time, not at an inappropriate one; (2) I’ll speak the truth, not falsehood; (3) I’ll speak gently, not harshly; (4) I’ll speak what’s beneficial, not what’s unbeneficial; (5) I’ll speak with a mind of good will, not with ill will.’”

pli-tv-pvr17:95.4.pli: codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:96.1.pli: “Codakena, bhante, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena kati dhamme ajjhattaṃ manasi karitvā paro codetabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:96.1.eng: “How many qualities should a monk attend to in himself before accusing another?”

pli-tv-pvr17:97.1.pli: “Codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ manasi karitvā paro codetabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:97.1.eng: “He should attend to five qualities in himself:

pli-tv-pvr17:97.3.eng: compassion, being of benefit, sympathy, the idea of clearing offenses, and the idea of prioritizing the training.”

pli-tv-pvr17:97.4.pli: codakenupāli, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ manasi karitvā paro codetabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:98.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātun”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:98.1.eng: “What sort of monk is unqualified to get permission to correct someone?”

pli-tv-pvr17:99.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:99.3.pli: Aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, aparisuddhājīvo hoti, bālo hoti abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṃ dātuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:99.3.eng: (1) he’s impure in bodily conduct; (2) he’s impure in verbal conduct; (3) he’s impure in livelihood; (4) he’s ignorant and incompetent; (5) he’s incapable of answering properly when questioned.”

pli-tv-pvr17:99.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa nālaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:100.1.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa alaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:100.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities is qualified to get permission to correct someone:

pli-tv-pvr17:100.3.pli: Parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, parisuddhājīvo hoti, paṇḍito hoti byatto paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṃ dātuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:100.3.eng: (1) he’s pure in bodily conduct; (2) he’s pure in verbal conduct; (3) he’s pure in livelihood; (4) he’s knowledgeable and competent; (5) he’s capable of answering properly when questioned.”

pli-tv-pvr17:100.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno okāsakammaṃ kārāpentassa alaṃ okāsakammaṃ kātun”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:101.1.pli: “Attādānaṃ ādātukāmena, bhante, bhikkhunā katihaṅgehi samannāgataṃ attādānaṃ ādātabban”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:101.1.eng: “Sir, if a monk wishes to raise an issue, what factors should be fulfilled?”

pli-tv-pvr17:102.3.pli: Attādānaṃ ādātukāmena, upāli, bhikkhunā evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ—

pli-tv-pvr17:102.4.pli: ‘yaṃ kho ahaṃ imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātukāmo, kālo nu kho imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātuṃ udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:102.4.eng: whether it’s the right time to raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:102.5.pli: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:102.6.pli: ‘akālo imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātuṃ no kālo’ti, na taṃ, upāli, attādānaṃ ādātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:102.6.eng: it’s the wrong time, he shouldn’t raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:103.1.pli: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:103.2.pli: ‘kālo imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātuṃ no akālo’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:103.2.eng: it’s the right time, he should reflect further

pli-tv-pvr17:103.3.pli: ‘yaṃ kho ahaṃ imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātukāmo bhūtaṃ nu kho idaṃ attādānaṃ udāhu no’ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:103.4.pli: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:103.5.pli: ‘abhūtaṃ idaṃ attādānaṃ no bhūtan’ti, na taṃ, upāli, attādānaṃ ādātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:103.5.eng: it’s not, he shouldn’t raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:104.1.pli: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:104.2.pli: ‘bhūtaṃ idaṃ attādānaṃ no abhūtan’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:104.2.eng: it is, he should reflect further

pli-tv-pvr17:104.3.pli: ‘yaṃ kho ahaṃ imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātukāmo, atthasaṃhitaṃ nu kho idaṃ attādānaṃ udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:104.3.eng: whether raising the issue will be beneficial.

pli-tv-pvr17:104.4.pli: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:104.5.pli: ‘anatthasaṃhitaṃ idaṃ attādānaṃ no atthasaṃhitan’ti, na taṃ, upāli, attādānaṃ ādātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:104.5.eng: it won’t, he shouldn’t raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:105.1.pli: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:105.2.pli: ‘atthasaṃhitaṃ idaṃ attādānaṃ no anatthasaṃhitan’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:105.2.eng: it will, he should reflect further

pli-tv-pvr17:105.3.pli: ‘imaṃ kho ahaṃ attādānaṃ ādiyamāno labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammato vinayato pakkhe udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:105.3.eng: whether the monks who are on the side of the Teaching and the Monastic Law will support him.

pli-tv-pvr17:105.4.pli: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:105.5.pli: ‘imaṃ kho ahaṃ attādānaṃ ādiyamāno na labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammato vinayato pakkhe’ti, na taṃ, upāli, attādānaṃ ādātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:105.5.eng: that they won’t, he shouldn’t raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:106.1.pli: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:106.2.pli: ‘idaṃ kho ahaṃ attādānaṃ ādiyamāno labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū dhammato vinayato pakkhe’ti, tenupāli, bhikkhunā uttari paccavekkhitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:106.2.eng: that they will, he should reflect further

pli-tv-pvr17:106.3.pli: ‘imaṃ kho me attādānaṃ ādiyato bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ udāhu no’ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:106.3.eng: whether raising the issue will lead to arguments and disputes, to fracture and schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr17:106.4.pli: Sace, upāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:106.5.pli: ‘imaṃ kho me attādānaṃ ādiyato bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, na taṃ, upāli, attādānaṃ ādātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:106.5.eng: it will, he shouldn’t raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:107.1.pli: Sace panupāli, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti—

pli-tv-pvr17:107.2.pli: ‘imaṃ kho me attādānaṃ ādiyato na bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, taṃ ādātabbaṃ, upāli, attādānaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:107.2.eng: it won’t, he may raise it.

pli-tv-pvr17:107.3.pli: Evaṃ pañcaṅgasamannāgataṃ kho, upāli, attādānaṃ ādinnaṃ pacchāpi avippaṭisārakaraṃ bhavissatī”ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:107.3.eng: In this way, when five factors are fulfilled, he won’t regret raising that issue.”

pli-tv-pvr17:108.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hotī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:108.1.eng: “What sort of monk is of great help to monks involved in a legal issue?”

pli-tv-pvr17:109.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hoti.

pli-tv-pvr17:109.3.pli: Sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
pli-tv-pvr17:109.3.eng: (1) He’s virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. He undertakes and trains in the training rules.

pli-tv-pvr17:109.4.eng: (2) He has learned much, and he retains and accumulates what he has learned.

pli-tv-pvr17:109.5.pli: ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti tathārūpassa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso;
pli-tv-pvr17:109.5.eng: (3) Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—he has learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view.

pli-tv-pvr17:109.6.pli: vinaye kho pana ṭhito hoti asaṃhīro;
pli-tv-pvr17:109.6.eng: (4) He’s firmly committed to the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr17:109.7.pli: paṭibalo hoti ubho atthapaccatthike assāsetuṃ saññāpetuṃ nijjhāpetuṃ pekkhetuṃ pasādetuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:109.7.eng: (5) He’s capable of making both sides relax, of persuading them, of convincing them, of making them see, of reconciling them.

pli-tv-pvr17:109.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hoti.

pli-tv-pvr17:110.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hoti.
pli-tv-pvr17:110.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities is also of great help to monks involved in a legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr17:110.3.pli: Parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, parisuddhājīvo hoti, paṇḍito hoti byatto, paṭibalo anuyuñjiyamāno anuyogaṃ dātuṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:110.3.eng: he’s pure in bodily conduct; he’s pure in verbal conduct; he’s pure in livelihood; he’s knowledgeable and competent; he’s capable of answering properly when questioned.

pli-tv-pvr17:110.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hoti.

pli-tv-pvr17:111.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hoti.
pli-tv-pvr17:111.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities is also of great help to monks involved in a legal issue:

pli-tv-pvr17:111.3.pli: Vatthuṃ jānāti, nidānaṃ jānāti, paññattiṃ jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:111.3.eng: he knows the actions that are the bases for offenses; he knows the origin stories; he knows the rules; he knows the right order of words; he knows the sequence of statements.”

pli-tv-pvr17:111.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu adhikaraṇajātānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāro hotī”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:112.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:112.1.eng: “Sir, what sort of monk shouldn’t be examined?”

pli-tv-pvr17:113.3.pli: Suttaṃ na jānāti, suttānulomaṃ na jānāti, vinayaṃ na jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ na jānāti, na ca ṭhānāṭhānakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:113.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the Monastic Code; (2) he doesn’t know what is in accordance with the Monastic Code; (3) he doesn’t know the Monastic Law; (4) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s not skilled in what is and is not possible.

pli-tv-pvr17:113.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:114.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:114.3.pli: Suttaṃ jānāti, suttānulomaṃ jānāti, vinayaṃ jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ jānāti, ṭhānāṭhānakusalo ca hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:114.3.eng: (1) he knows the Monastic Code; (2) he knows what’s in accordance with the Monastic Code; (3) he knows the Monastic Law; (4) he knows what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s skilled in what is and is not possible.

pli-tv-pvr17:114.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:115.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:115.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:115.3.pli: Dhammaṃ na jānāti, dhammānulomaṃ na jānāti, vinayaṃ na jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ na jānāti, na ca pubbāparakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:115.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the Teaching; (2) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Teaching; (3) he doesn’t know the Monastic Law; (4) he doesn’t know what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s not skilled in the right order.

pli-tv-pvr17:115.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:116.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:116.3.pli: Dhammaṃ jānāti, dhammānulomaṃ jānāti, vinayaṃ jānāti, vinayānulomaṃ jānāti, pubbāparakusalo ca hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:116.3.eng: (1) he knows the Teaching; (2) he knows what’s in accordance with the Teaching; (3) he knows the Monastic Law; (4) he knows what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law; (5) he’s skilled in the right order.

pli-tv-pvr17:116.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:117.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:117.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:117.3.pli: Vatthuṃ na jānāti, nidānaṃ na jānāti, paññattiṃ na jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ na jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:117.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the actions that are the bases for offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the origin stories; (3) he doesn’t know the rules; (4) he doesn’t know the right order of words; (5) he doesn’t know the sequence of statements.

pli-tv-pvr17:117.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:118.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:118.3.pli: Vatthuṃ jānāti, nidānaṃ jānāti, paññattiṃ jānāti, padapaccābhaṭṭhaṃ jānāti, anusandhivacanapathaṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:118.3.eng: (1) he knows the actions that are the bases for offenses; (2) he knows the origin stories; (3) he knows the rules; (4) he knows the right order of words; (5) he knows the sequence of statements.

pli-tv-pvr17:118.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:119.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:119.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:119.3.pli: Āpattiṃ na jānāti, āpattisamuṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā payogaṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā vūpasamaṃ na jānāti, āpattiyā na vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:119.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the origination of the offenses; (3) he doesn’t know the kind of effort required to commit the offenses; (4) he doesn’t know the settling of offenses; (5) he’s not skilled in deciding on offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:119.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:120.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:120.3.pli: Āpattiṃ jānāti, āpattisamuṭṭhānaṃ jānāti, āpattiyā payogaṃ jānāti, āpattiyā vūpasamaṃ jānāti, āpattiyā vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:120.3.eng: (1) he knows the offenses; (2) he knows the origination of the offenses; (3) he knows the kind of effort required to commit the offenses; (4) he knows the settling of offenses; (5) he’s skilled in deciding on offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:120.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:121.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:121.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:121.3.pli: Adhikaraṇaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa payogaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vūpasamaṃ na jānāti, adhikaraṇassa na vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:121.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the legal issues; (2) he doesn’t know the origination of the legal issues; (3) he doesn’t know the kind of effort that’s the source of the legal issues; (4) he doesn’t know the settling of legal issues; (5) he’s not skilled in deciding legal issues.

pli-tv-pvr17:121.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nānuyuñjitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:122.1.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be examined:

pli-tv-pvr17:122.3.pli: Adhikaraṇaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇasamuṭṭhānaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa payogaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vūpasamaṃ jānāti, adhikaraṇassa vinicchayakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:122.3.eng: (1) he knows the legal issues; (2) he knows the origination of the legal issues; (3) he knows the kind of effort that’s the source of the legal issues; (4) he knows the settling of legal issues; (5) he’s skilled in deciding legal issues.”

pli-tv-pvr17:122.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā anuyuñjitabban”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:123.1.eng: The fifth subchapter on raising an issue is finished.

pli-tv-pvr17:125.4.eng: And also other, and the actions that are the bases;

pli-tv-pvr17:125.5.eng: The Monastic Code, the Teaching, and the actions that are the bases,

pli-tv-pvr17:126.1.eng: “Sir, how many kinds of wilderness dwellers are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:126.4.pli: Mandattā momūhattā āraññiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato āraññiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā āraññiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṃ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti āraññiko hoti, api ca appicchaññeva nissāya santuṭṭhiññeva nissāya, sallekhaññeva nissāya pavivekaññeva nissāya idamatthitaññeva nissāya āraññiko hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:126.4.eng: those who are wilderness dwellers: (1) because of stupidity and folly; (2) because they are overcome by bad desires; (3) because of insanity and derangement; (4) because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples; (5) because of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and not needing anything else.”
pli-tv-pvr17:126.4.comm: Sp 5.325: Taṁ idamatthitaṁyeva nissāya na aññaṁ kiñci lokāmisanti attho, “They depend on ‘not needing anything else’, not on any other material things. This is the meaning.”

pli-tv-pvr17:127.1.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who only eat almsfood?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.2.eng: “How many kinds of rag-robe wearers are there?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.3.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who live at the foot of a tree?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.4.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who live in charnel grounds?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.5.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who live out in the open?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.6.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who only have three robes?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.7.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who go on continuous almsround?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.8.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who never lie down?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.9.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who accept any kind of resting place?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.10.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who eat in one sitting per day?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.11.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who refuse to accept food offered after the meal has begun?” …

pli-tv-pvr17:127.12.eng: “How many kinds of people are there who eat only from the almsbowl?”

pli-tv-pvr17:127.15.pli: Mandattā momūhattā pattapiṇḍiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato pattapiṇḍiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā pattapiṇḍiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṃ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti pattapiṇḍiko hoti, api ca appicchaññeva nissāya santuṭṭhiññeva nissāya sallekhaññeva nissāya pavivekaññeva nissāya idamatthitaññeva nissāya pattapiṇḍiko hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:127.15.eng: those who eat only from the almsbowl: (1) because of stupidity and folly; (2) because they are overcome by bad desires; (3) because of insanity and derangement; (4) because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples; (5) because of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and not needing anything else.”

pli-tv-pvr17:128.1.eng: The sixth subchapter on ascetic practices is finished.

pli-tv-pvr17:130.2.eng: Tree, charnel ground is the fifth;

pli-tv-pvr17:130.3.eng: Out in the open, and the three robes,

pli-tv-pvr17:130.4.eng: Continuous, those who never lie down;

pli-tv-pvr17:130.6.eng: After, those who eat only from the bowl.”

pli-tv-pvr17:131.1.eng: “Sir, how many kinds of lying are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:131.4.pli: Atthi musāvādo pārājikagāmī, atthi musāvādo saṅghādisesagāmī, atthi musāvādo thullaccayagāmī, atthi musāvādo pācittiyagāmī, atthi musāvādo dukkaṭagāmī—
pli-tv-pvr17:131.4.eng: (1) there’s lying that leads to an offense entailing expulsion; (2) there’s lying that leads to an offense entailing suspension; (3) there’s lying that leads to a serious offense; (4) there’s lying that leads to an offense entailing confession; (5) there’s lying that leads to an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-pvr17:132.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:132.1.eng: “A monk may be canceling someone’s observance day or invitation in the midst of the Sangha. Among such monks, what sort should be pressed: ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ with the Sangha then doing the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony?”

pli-tv-pvr17:133.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā.

pli-tv-pvr17:133.3.pli: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, cāvanādhippāyo vattā hoti, no vuṭṭhānādhippāyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:133.3.eng: he’s shameless; he’s ignorant; he’s not a regular monk; he speaks to make someone disrobe, not with the aim of clearing their offenses.

pli-tv-pvr17:133.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā ṭhapentassa—

pli-tv-pvr17:133.5.pli: ‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā.

pli-tv-pvr17:134.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā.
pli-tv-pvr17:134.1.eng: The same procedure should be followed also for a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:134.3.pli: Aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti, aparisuddhājīvo hoti, bālo hoti abyatto, bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako—
pli-tv-pvr17:134.3.eng: he’s impure in bodily conduct; he’s impure in verbal conduct; he’s impure in livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent; he’s quarrelsome and argumentative.”

pli-tv-pvr17:134.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno saṅghamajjhe uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā ṭhapentassa—‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā kātabbā”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:135.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:135.1.eng: “What sort of monk shouldn’t be allowed to question?”

pli-tv-pvr17:136.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:136.3.pli: Āpattānāpattiṃ na jānāti, lahukagarukaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti, sappaṭikammāpaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ na jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:136.3.eng: (1) he doesn’t know the offenses and non-offenses; (2) he doesn’t know the light and heavy offenses; (3) he doesn’t know the curable and incurable offenses; (4) he doesn’t know the grave and minor offenses; (5) he doesn’t know the offenses that are clearable by making amends and the offenses that are not clearable by making amends.

pli-tv-pvr17:136.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo na dātabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:137.1.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo dātabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:137.1.eng: But a monk who has five other qualities may question:

pli-tv-pvr17:137.3.pli: Āpattānāpattiṃ jānāti, lahukagarukaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, sāvasesānavasesaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti, sappaṭikammāpaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ jānāti—
pli-tv-pvr17:137.3.eng: (1) he knows the offenses and non-offenses; (2) he knows the light and heavy offenses; (3) he knows the curable and incurable offenses; (4) he knows the grave and minor offenses; (5) he knows the offenses that are clearable by making amends and the offenses that are not clearable by making amends.”

pli-tv-pvr17:137.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno anuyogo dātabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:138.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, ākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjatī”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:138.1.eng: “For how many reasons does a monk commit an offense?”

pli-tv-pvr17:138.4.pli: Alajjitā, aññāṇatā, kukkuccapakatatā, akappiye kappiyasaññitā, kappiye akappiyasaññitā—
pli-tv-pvr17:138.4.eng: because of shamelessness; because of ignorance; because of being overcome by anxiety; because of perceiving what’s unallowable as allowable; because of perceiving what’s allowable as unallowable.

pli-tv-pvr17:138.5.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr17:139.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr17:139.1.eng: A monk also commits an offense for five other reasons:

pli-tv-pvr17:139.3.eng: because of not seeing; because of not hearing; because of sleeping; because of perceiving it as allowable; because of absentmindedness.”
pli-tv-pvr17:139.3.comm: Sp 5.447: Adassanenāti vinayadharassa adassanena. … Assavanenāti ekavihārepi vasanto pana vinayadharassa upaṭṭhānaṁ gantvā kappiyākappiyaṁ apucchitvā vā aññesañca vuccamānaṁ asuṇanto āpajjatiyeva, tena vuttaṁ “assavanenā”ti. Pasuttakatāti pasuttakatāya. Sahagāraseyyañhi pasuttakabhāvenapi āpajjati, “‘Because of not seeing’: because of not seeing an expert on the Monastic Law. … ‘Because of not hearing’: when living in a monastery, one goes to attend on an expert in the Monastic Law, then, having asked and being spoken to about something else, one ends up not hearing about it. It is because of that that it is said ‘because of not hearing’. ‘Because of sleeping’: due to sleeping. One commits the offense while sleeping in the same sleeping place in a house.” The offenses committed ‘because of sleeping’ refers to Bu Pc 5:2.16.1 and Bu Pc 6:1.51.1, and the corresponding rules for bhikkhunīs.

pli-tv-pvr17:139.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahākārehi bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjatī”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:140.4.eng: killing living beings; stealing; sexual misconduct; lying; alcohol, which causes heedlessness.”

pli-tv-pvr17:141.4.pli: Pāṇātipātā veramaṇī, adinnādānā veramaṇī, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī, musāvādā veramaṇī, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇī—

pli-tv-pvr17:147.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṃ kātabban”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:147.1.eng: “Sir, against what sort of monk should the Sangha of nuns do a legal procedure?”

pli-tv-pvr17:148.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.
pli-tv-pvr17:148.1.eng: “They should do a legal procedure, prohibiting the Sangha of nuns from paying respect to him, against a monk who has five qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:148.3.pli: Vivaritvā kāyaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ dasseti, ūruṃ dasseti, aṅgajātaṃ dasseti, ubho aṃsakūṭe dasseti, obhāsati, gihī sampayojeti—
pli-tv-pvr17:148.3.eng: (1) he exposes his body to the nuns; (2) he exposes his thighs to the nuns; (3) he exposes his genitals to the nuns; (4) he exposes both shoulders to the nuns; (5) he speaks indecently to the nuns; he associates inappropriately with householders.
pli-tv-pvr17:148.3.comm: It is not clear why this is considered five rather than six items. Perhaps the last item on householders is not to be counted. The same list recurs at Kd 20:9.1.18, but without “he exposes both shoulders to the nuns” and without any reference to householders. The exposition at Kd 20 seems more plausible.

pli-tv-pvr17:148.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-pvr17:149.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.
pli-tv-pvr17:149.1.eng: They should do the same legal procedure also against a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:149.3.pli: Bhikkhunīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, bhikkhunīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, bhikkhunīnaṃ avāsāya parisakkati, bhikkhuniyo akkosati paribhāsati, bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi bhedeti—
pli-tv-pvr17:149.3.eng: (1) he’s trying to stop nuns from getting material support; (2) he’s trying to harm nuns; (3) he’s trying to get nuns to lose their place of residence; (4) he abuses and reviles nuns; (5) he causes division between the monks and the nuns.

pli-tv-pvr17:149.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno bhikkhunisaṅgheneva kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, avandiyo so bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena.

pli-tv-pvr17:151.1.eng: “Against what sort of nun should a legal procedure be done?”

pli-tv-pvr17:155.1.eng: “What sort of monk shouldn’t cancel the nuns’ instruction?”

pli-tv-pvr17:156.3.pli: Alajjī ca hoti, bālo ca, apakatatto ca, cāvanādhippāyo vattā hoti, no vuṭṭhānādhippāyo—

pli-tv-pvr17:156.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṃ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:157.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t cancel the nuns’ instruction:

pli-tv-pvr17:158.3.pli: Kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, bhikkhunīnaṃ akkosakaparibhāsako hoti, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikena saṃsaggena—

pli-tv-pvr17:158.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnaṃ ovādo na ṭhapetabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:159.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t cancel the nuns’ instruction:

pli-tv-pvr17:160.1.eng: “What sort of monk shouldn’t agree to instruct the nuns?”

pli-tv-pvr17:163.1.eng: “What sort of monk should one not have a discussion with?”

pli-tv-pvr17:164.3.pli: Na asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, na asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—

pli-tv-pvr17:164.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ na sākacchitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:164.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ sākacchitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:164.5.eng: But one may have a discussion with a monk who has five qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:164.7.pli: Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekkhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:164.7.eng: he has the virtue, stillness, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom of one who’s fully trained.

pli-tv-pvr17:164.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ sākacchitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:165.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ na sākacchitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:165.1.eng: One also shouldn’t have a discussion with a monk who has five other qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:165.3.pli: Na atthapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, na dhammapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, na niruttipaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, na paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ na paccavekkhitā—
pli-tv-pvr17:165.3.eng: he hasn’t achieved the analysis of meaning, the analysis of text, the analysis of terminology, and the analysis of articulation, and he hasn’t reviewed the extent of his mind’s freedom.

pli-tv-pvr17:165.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ na sākacchitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:165.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ sākacchitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:165.5.eng: But one may have a discussion with a monk who has five qualities:

pli-tv-pvr17:165.7.pli: Atthapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, dhammapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, niruttipaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitā—
pli-tv-pvr17:165.7.eng: he has achieved the analysis of meaning, the analysis of text, the analysis of terminology, and the analysis of articulation, and he reviews the extent of his mind’s freedom.”

pli-tv-pvr17:165.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ sākacchitabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:169.1.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo”ti?

pli-tv-pvr17:170.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:170.3.pli: Na atthakusalo hoti, na dhammakusalo hoti, na niruttikusalo hoti, na byañjanakusalo hoti, na pubbāparakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:170.3.eng: he’s not skilled in the meaning, the Teaching, the terminology, the wording, or the right order.

pli-tv-pvr17:170.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:170.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:170.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:170.7.pli: Atthakusalo hoti, dhammakusalo hoti, niruttikusalo hoti, byañjanakusalo hoti, pubbāparakusalo hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:170.7.eng: he’s skilled in the meaning, the Teaching, the terminology, the wording, and the right order.

pli-tv-pvr17:170.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:171.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:171.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:171.3.pli: Kodhano hoti kodhābhibhūto, makkhī hoti makkhābhibhūto, paḷāsī hoti paḷāsābhibhūto, issukī hoti issābhibhūto, sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī—
pli-tv-pvr17:171.3.eng: (1) he’s angry, overcome by anger; (2) he’s denigrating, overcome by denigration; (3) he’s domineering, overcome by being domineering; (4) he’s envious, overcome by envy; (5) he obstinately grasps his own views and only gives them up with difficulty.

pli-tv-pvr17:171.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:171.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:171.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:171.7.pli: Na kodhano hoti na kodhābhibhūto, na makkhī hoti na makkhābhibhūto, na paḷāsī hoti na paḷāsābhibhūto, na issukī hoti na issābhibhūto, asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī—
pli-tv-pvr17:171.7.eng: (1) he’s not angry or overcome by anger; (2) he’s not denigrating or overcome by denigration; (3) he’s not domineering or overcome by being domineering; (4) he’s not envious or overcome by envy; (5) he doesn’t obstinately grasp his own views and gives them up with ease.

pli-tv-pvr17:171.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:172.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:172.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:172.3.pli: Kuppati, byāpajjati, patiṭṭhiyati, kopaṃ janeti, akkhamo hoti apadakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:172.3.eng: he (1) gets agitated, (2) has ill will, (3) becomes hardhearted, (4) gives rise to anger, and (5) is resistant and doesn’t receive instructions respectfully.

pli-tv-pvr17:172.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:172.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:172.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:172.7.pli: Na kuppati, na byāpajjati, na patiṭṭhiyati, na kopaṃ janeti, khamo hoti padakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:172.7.eng: he (1) doesn’t get agitated, (2) doesn’t have ill will, (3) doesn’t become hardhearted, (4) doesn’t give rise to anger, and (5) isn’t resistant but receives instructions respectfully.

pli-tv-pvr17:172.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:173.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:173.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:173.3.pli: Pasāretā hoti no sāretā, anokāsakammaṃ kāretvā pavattā hoti, na yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, na yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti, na yathādiṭṭhiyā byākatā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:173.3.eng: (1) he causes confusion, not recollection; (2) he speaks without having gotten permission; (3) he doesn’t accuse others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, or their offense; (4) he doesn’t act according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, or his offenses; (5) he doesn’t explain things according to his own view.
pli-tv-pvr17:173.3.comm: Sp 5.455: Pasāretā hoti no sāretāti mohetā hoti, na satiuppādetā; codakacuditakānaṁ kathaṁ moheti pidahati na sāretīti attho, “‘He causes confusion, not recollection’: he confuses, does not cause others to remember; the meaning is that, in regard to the speech of the accuser and the one who is accused, he confuses, conceals, and does not cause them to remember.”

pli-tv-pvr17:173.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:173.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:173.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:173.7.pli: Sāretā hoti no pasāretā, okāsakammaṃ kāretvā pavattā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā codetā hoti, yathādhamme yathāvinaye yathāpattiyā kāretā hoti, yathādiṭṭhiyā byākatā hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:173.7.eng: (1) he causes recollection, not confusion; (2) he speaks after getting permission; (3) he accuses others according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and their offense; (4) he acts according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and his offenses; (5) he explains things according to his own view.

pli-tv-pvr17:173.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:174.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:174.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:174.3.pli: Chandāgatiṃ gacchati, dosāgatiṃ gacchati, mohāgatiṃ gacchati, bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, alajjī ca hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:174.3.eng: he’s biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he’s shameless.

pli-tv-pvr17:174.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:174.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:174.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:174.7.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, lajjī ca hoti—
pli-tv-pvr17:174.7.eng: he’s not biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he has a sense of conscience.

pli-tv-pvr17:174.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:175.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:175.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities also shouldn’t be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:175.3.pli: Chandāgatiṃ gacchati, dosāgatiṃ gacchati, mohāgatiṃ gacchati, bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, akusalo ca hoti vinaye—
pli-tv-pvr17:175.3.eng: he’s biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he’s unskilled in the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr17:175.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya na sammannitabbo.

pli-tv-pvr17:175.5.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-pvr17:175.5.eng: But a monk who has five qualities may be appointed to a committee:

pli-tv-pvr17:175.7.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, kusalo ca hoti vinaye—
pli-tv-pvr17:175.7.eng: he’s not biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he’s skilled in the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-pvr17:175.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:177.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu paṇḍitotveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

pli-tv-pvr17:178.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu bālotveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
pli-tv-pvr17:178.1.eng: A monk who has five other qualities is also considered ignorant:

pli-tv-pvr17:179.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu bālotveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

pli-tv-pvr17:179.8.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu paṇḍitotveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

pli-tv-pvr17:180.1.pli: Aparehipi, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato bhikkhu bālotveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

pli-tv-pvr17:196.4.eng: through a legal procedure, through recitation, through speaking, through a proclamation, and through voting.”

pli-tv-pvr17:197.1.eng: “Sir, we speak of ‘fracture in the Sangha’.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgharāji hoti no ca saṅghabhedo?
pli-tv-pvr17:197.2.eng: But how is there fracture in the Sangha, yet not schism?

pli-tv-pvr17:197.3.pli: Kittāvatā ca pana saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo cā”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:197.3.eng: And how is there both fracture and schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-pvr17:197.4.eng: “(1) Upāli, I’ve laid down the proper conduct for newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.5.pli: Evaṃ supaññatte kho, upāli, mayā sikkhāpade āgantukā bhikkhū āgantukavatte na vattanti.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.5.eng: Even though I’ve carefully laid down the training rules, the newly-arrived monks don’t practice that proper conduct.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.6.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.6.eng: In this way, there’s fracture in the Sangha, but not schism.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.7.pli: Paññattetaṃ, upāli, mayā āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āvāsikavattaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.7.eng: (2) I’ve laid down the proper conduct for resident monks.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.8.pli: Evaṃ supaññatte kho, upāli, mayā sikkhāpade āvāsikā bhikkhū āvāsikavatte na vattanti.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.8.eng: Even though I’ve carefully laid down the training rules, the resident monks don’t practice that proper conduct.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.9.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.9.eng: In this way, there’s fracture in the Sangha, but not schism.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.10.pli: Paññattetaṃ, upāli, mayā bhikkhūnaṃ bhattagge bhattaggavattaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:197.10.eng: (3) I’ve laid down the proper conduct for monks in the dining hall:

pli-tv-pvr17:197.11.pli: yathāvuḍḍhaṃ yathārattaṃ yathāpatirūpaṃ aggāsanaṃ aggodakaṃ aggapiṇḍaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.11.eng: the best seat, the best water, and the best almsfood is to be given out according to seniority and according to what’s proper.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.12.pli: Evaṃ supaññatte kho, upāli, mayā sikkhāpade navā bhikkhū bhattagge therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āsanaṃ paṭibāhanti.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.12.eng: Even though I’ve carefully laid down the training rules, the junior monks block the senior monks from seats.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.13.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.13.eng: In this way, there’s fracture in the Sangha, but not schism.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.14.pli: Paññattetaṃ, upāli, mayā bhikkhūnaṃ senāsane senāsanavattaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr17:197.14.eng: (4) I’ve laid down the proper conduct for the monks in regard to dwellings:

pli-tv-pvr17:197.15.eng: they’re to be given out according to seniority and according to what’s proper.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.16.pli: Evaṃ supaññatte kho, upāli, mayā sikkhāpade navā bhikkhū therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanaṃ paṭibāhanti.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.16.eng: Even though I’ve carefully laid down the training rules, the junior monks block the senior monks from dwellings.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.17.pli: Evampi kho, upāli, saṅgharāji hoti no ca saṅghabhedo.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.17.eng: In this way, there’s fracture in the Sangha, but not schism.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.18.pli: Paññattetaṃ, upāli, mayā bhikkhūnaṃ antosīmāya ekaṃ uposathaṃ ekaṃ pavāraṇaṃ ekaṃ saṅghakammaṃ ekaṃ kammākammaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.18.eng: (5) For monks within the same monastery zone, I’ve laid down this: a joint observance-day ceremony; a joint invitation ceremony; joint legal procedures of the Sangha; joint legal procedures of whatever kind.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.19.pli: Evaṃ supaññatte kho, upāli, mayā sikkhāpade tattheva antosīmāya āvenibhāvaṃ karitvā gaṇaṃ bandhitvā āveniṃ uposathaṃ karonti āveniṃ pavāraṇaṃ karonti āveniṃ saṅghakammaṃ karonti āveniṃ kammākammāni karonti.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.19.eng: Even though I’ve carefully laid down the training rules, they form a faction, a subgroup, right there within the monastery zone. They then do a separate observance-day ceremony, a separate invitation ceremony, separate legal procedures of the Sangha, or separate legal procedures of whatever kind.

pli-tv-pvr17:197.20.pli: Evaṃ kho, upāli, saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo cā”ti.
pli-tv-pvr17:197.20.eng: In this way, there’s both fracture and schism in the Sangha.”

pli-tv-pvr17:201.1.eng: “Sir, what sort of monk who has caused a schism in the Sangha is irredeemably destined to an eon in hell?”

pli-tv-pvr17:202.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato saṅghabhedako āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.

pli-tv-pvr17:202.3.pli: Idhupāli, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti, dhammaṃ adhammoti dīpeti, avinayaṃ vinayoti dīpeti, vinayaṃ avinayoti dīpeti, vinidhāya diṭṭhiṃ kammena—
pli-tv-pvr17:202.3.eng: (1) a monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it, (2) what’s in accordance with the Teaching as contrary to it, (3) what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as being in accordance with it, (4) what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as contrary to it, and (5) he misrepresents his view of what’s true during the legal procedure.
pli-tv-pvr17:202.3.comm: Sp 5.458: Vinidhāya diṭṭhiṁ kammenāti tesu adhammādīsu adhammādayo eteti evaṁdiṭṭhikova hutvā taṁ diṭṭhiṁ vinidhāya te dhammādivasena dīpetvā visuṁ kammaṁ karoti, “‘He misrepresents his view of what is true during the legal procedure’: in regard to what is not the Teaching, etc., he has the view that it is not the Teaching, etc., but he misrepresents that view, proclaiming it is the Teaching, etc., and he then does a separate legal procedure.” The separate legal procedure is what finalizes the schism.

pli-tv-pvr17:203.3.comm: That is, the recitation that finalizes the schism. And the same below.

pli-tv-pvr17:226.1.eng: “Sir, what sort of resident monk is dumped in hell?”

pli-tv-pvr17:227.1.pli: “Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.

pli-tv-pvr17:227.3.pli: Chandāgatiṃ gacchati, dosāgatiṃ gacchati, mohāgatiṃ gacchati, bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, saṅghikaṃ puggalikaparibhogena paribhuñjati—
pli-tv-pvr17:227.3.eng: he’s biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he uses what belongs to the Sangha as if belonging to an individual.

pli-tv-pvr17:227.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.

pli-tv-pvr17:228.1.pli: Pañcahupāli, aṅgehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
pli-tv-pvr17:228.1.eng: But a resident monk who has five qualities is deposited in heaven:

pli-tv-pvr17:228.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, saṅghikaṃ na puggalikaparibhogena paribhuñjati—
pli-tv-pvr17:228.3.eng: he’s not biased by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he doesn’t use what belongs to the Sangha as if belonging to an individual.”

pli-tv-pvr17:228.4.pli: imehi kho, upāli, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:229.1.eng: “How many illegitimate explanations of the Monastic Law are there?”

pli-tv-pvr17:230.3.pli: Idhupāli, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti pariṇāmeti, dhammaṃ adhammoti pariṇāmeti, avinayaṃ vinayoti pariṇāmeti, vinayaṃ avinayoti pariṇāmeti, apaññattaṃ paññāpeti, paññattaṃ samucchindati—
pli-tv-pvr17:230.3.eng: (1) a monk develops what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it, (2) what’s in accordance with the Teaching as contrary to it, (3) what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as being in accordance with it, (4) what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as contrary to it, and (5) he lays down new rules and gets rid of the existing ones.
pli-tv-pvr17:230.3.comm: Sp 5.462: Pariṇāmetīti niyāmeti dīpeti katheti, “Develops: he specifies, he proclaims, he speaks.” The basic meaning of pariṇāmeti is to change, often a change towards ripening or maturity. The meaning here is presumably that he changes or transforms the Teaching and the Monastic Law by distorting them.

pli-tv-pvr17:230.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca adhammikā vinayabyākaraṇā.

pli-tv-pvr17:230.5.eng: And there are five legitimate explanations of the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-pvr17:230.7.pli: Idhupāli, bhikkhu adhammaṃ adhammoti pariṇāmeti, dhammaṃ dhammoti pariṇāmeti, avinayaṃ avinayoti pariṇāmeti, vinayaṃ vinayoti pariṇāmeti, apaññattaṃ na paññapeti, paññattaṃ na samucchindati—
pli-tv-pvr17:230.7.eng: (1) a monk develops what’s contrary to the Teaching to what’s contrary to the Teaching, (2) what’s in accordance with the Teaching to what’s in accordance with the Teaching, (3) what’s contrary to the Monastic Law to what’s contrary to the Monastic Law, (4) what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law to what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law, and (5) he doesn’t lay down new rules or get rid of the existing ones.”

pli-tv-pvr17:230.8.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca dhammikā vinayabyākaraṇā”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:240.0.eng: 14. The subchapter on the robe-making ceremony

pli-tv-pvr17:240.1.eng: “Sir, how many benefits are there in participating in the robe-making ceremony?”

pli-tv-pvr17:241.3.pli: Anāmantacāro, asamādānacāro, gaṇabhojanaṃ, yāvadatthacīvaraṃ, yo ca tattha cīvaruppādo so nesaṃ bhavissati—
pli-tv-pvr17:241.3.eng: (1) going without informing; (2) going without taking; (3) eating in a group; (4) as much extra robe-cloth as you need; and (5) whatever robe-cloth is given there is for you.”
pli-tv-pvr17:241.3.comm: For the first four of these five see Bu Pc 46:5.6.1, Bu NP 2:2.39.1, Bu Pc 32:8.15.1, and Bu NP 1:2.17.1 respectively.

pli-tv-pvr17:241.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca ānisaṃsā kathinatthāre”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:242.1.pli: “Kati nu kho, bhante, ādīnavā muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:242.1.eng: “How many drawbacks are there in falling asleep absentminded and heedless?”

pli-tv-pvr17:243.1.pli: “Pañcime, upāli, ādīnavā muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato.

pli-tv-pvr17:243.3.pli: Dukkhaṃ supati, dukkhaṃ paṭibujjhati, pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, devatā na rakkhanti, asuci muccati—
pli-tv-pvr17:243.3.eng: you don’t sleep well; you wake up feeling miserable; you have nightmares; the gods don’t guard you; you emit semen.

pli-tv-pvr17:243.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca ādīnavā muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato.

pli-tv-pvr17:244.1.pli: Pañcime, upāli, ānisaṃsā upaṭṭhitassatissa sampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato.
pli-tv-pvr17:244.1.eng: But there are five benefits in falling asleep mindfully, with clear awareness:

pli-tv-pvr17:244.3.pli: Sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, devatā rakkhanti, asuci na muccati—
pli-tv-pvr17:244.3.eng: you sleep well; you wake up feeling good; you don’t have nightmares; the gods guard you; you don’t emit semen.”

pli-tv-pvr17:244.4.pli: ime kho, upāli, pañca ānisaṃsā upaṭṭhitassatissa sampajānassa niddaṃ okkamato”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:245.1.eng: “How many kinds of people should one not pay respect to?”

pli-tv-pvr17:246.3.pli: Antaragharaṃ paviṭṭho avandiyo, racchagato avandiyo, otamasiko avandiyo, asamannāharanto avandiyo, sutto avandiyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:246.3.eng: one who has entered an inhabited area; one who’s walking along a street; one who’s in the dark; one who’s not paying attention; one who’s asleep.
pli-tv-pvr17:246.3.comm: Sp 5.467: Asamannāharantoti kiccayapasutattā vandanaṁ asamannāharanto, “‘One who’s not paying attention’: not paying attention to the paying respect because of being occupied with a task.”

pli-tv-pvr17:247.1.eng: There are five other kinds of people you also shouldn’t pay respect to:

pli-tv-pvr17:247.3.pli: Yāgupāne avandiyo, bhattagge avandiyo, ekāvatto avandiyo, aññavihito avandiyo, naggo avandiyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:247.3.eng: one who’s drinking congee; one who’s in the dining hall; one who has turned away; one who’s preoccupied with something else; one who’s naked.

pli-tv-pvr17:248.1.eng: There are five other kinds of people you also shouldn’t pay respect to:

pli-tv-pvr17:248.3.pli: Khādanto avandiyo, bhuñjanto avandiyo, uccāraṃ karonto avandiyo, passāvaṃ karonto avandiyo, ukkhittako avandiyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:248.3.eng: one who’s eating fresh food; one who’s eating cooked food; one who’s defecating; one who’s urinating; one who has been ejected.

pli-tv-pvr17:249.1.eng: There are five other kinds of people you also shouldn’t pay respect to:

pli-tv-pvr17:249.3.pli: Pure upasampannena pacchā upasampanno avandiyo, anupasampanno avandiyo, nānāsaṃvāsako vuḍḍhataro adhammavādī avandiyo, mātugāmo avandiyo, paṇḍako avandiyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:249.3.eng: (1) one who has been given the full ordination after you; (2) one who isn’t fully ordained; (3) one who belongs to a different Buddhist sect who’s senior to you, but who speaks contrary to the Teaching; (4) a woman; (5) a paṇḍaka.

pli-tv-pvr17:250.1.eng: There are five other kinds of people you also shouldn’t pay respect to:

pli-tv-pvr17:250.3.pli: Pārivāsiko avandiyo, mūlāyapaṭikassanāraho avandiyo, mānattāraho avandiyo, mānattacāriko avandiyo, abbhānāraho avandiyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:250.3.eng: (1) one who’s on probation; (2) one who deserves to be sent back to the beginning; (3) one who deserves the trial period; (4) one who’s undertaking the trial period; (5) one who deserves rehabilitation.”

pli-tv-pvr17:251.1.eng: “But how many kinds of people should one pay respect to?”

pli-tv-pvr17:252.3.pli: Pacchā upasampannena pure upasampanno vandiyo, nānāsaṃvāsako vuḍḍhataro dhammavādī vandiyo, ācariyo vandiyo, upajjhāyo vandiyo, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya tathāgato arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vandiyo—
pli-tv-pvr17:252.3.eng: (1) one who has been given the full ordination before you; (2) one who belongs to a different Buddhist sect who’s senior to you and who speaks in accordance with the Teaching; (3) your teacher; (4) your preceptor; and (5) in this world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, in this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, you should pay respect to the Buddha, perfected and fully awakened.”

pli-tv-pvr17:253.1.pli: “Navakatarena, bhante, bhikkhunā vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno pāde vandantena kati dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā pādā vanditabbā”ti?
pli-tv-pvr17:253.1.eng: “Sir, when a monk is paying respect to a more senior monk, how many qualities should he first set up in himself?”

pli-tv-pvr17:254.1.pli: “Navakatarenupāli, bhikkhunā vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno pāde vandantena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā pādā vanditabbā.
pli-tv-pvr17:254.1.eng: “He should set up five qualities in himself:

pli-tv-pvr17:254.3.pli: Navakatarenupāli, bhikkhunā vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno pāde vandantena ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā, añjaliṃ paggahetvā, ubhohi pāṇitalehi pādāni parisambāhantena, pemañca gāravañca upaṭṭhāpetvā pādā vanditabbā—
pli-tv-pvr17:254.3.eng: (1) he should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder; (2) he should raise his joined palms; (3) he should stroke the feet with the palms of both hands; (4) he should set up a sense of affection; (5) he should set up a sense of respect.”

pli-tv-pvr17:254.4.pli: navakatarenupāli bhikkhunā vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno pāde vandantena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā pādā vanditabbā”ti.

pli-tv-pvr17:255.1.eng: The fourteenth subchapter on the robe-making ceremony is finished.

pli-tv-pvr17:257.2.eng: Inhabited, congee, when eating fresh food;

pli-tv-pvr17:257.3.eng: And before, and one on probation,

pli-tv-pvr17:257.4.eng: Should pay respect to, to be paid respect.”
